clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Efficacy of Liraglutide, Metformin and Gliclazide MR on Hepatic Lipid Content in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes (T2DM) and Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver (NAFLD)

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: This was a 24-week single-center, open-label, parallel controlled group comparing gliclazide, liraglutide, and metformin effects on diabetes with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Following enrollment, eligible participants were randomized (1:1:1) using computer-generated random numbers to the metformin (Glucophage, Bristol-Myers Squibb), liraglutide (Victoza, Novo Nordisk), or gliclazide (Diamicron, Servier) groups. All patients were informed about a proper diet and exercise. For the metformin group (n = 31), the dosage was 250 mg thrice a day during the first week, 500 mg thrice a day during the second week, and 1000 mg twice a day from the third week to the conclusion of the study. For the gliclazide group (n = 31), the initial dosage was 30 mg before breakfast, which was gradually titrated to a maximum of 120 mg/day to achieve a fasting capillary plasma glucose of <7.0 mmol/L. For the liraglutide group (n = 31), the dosage was 0.6 mg/day during the first week, 1.2 mg/day during the second week, and 1.8 mg/day from the third week to the conclusion of the study.At the end of the study, data will be collected and analyzed.

primary_outcome.description: intrahepatic fat change from baseline by quantitative ultrasound

secondary_outcome.description: serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and serum aspartate aminotransferase (AST)
total cholesterol (CH), triglyceride (TG), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL), and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma glucose in standard meal tolerance test
secondary_outcome.description: plasma glucose was measured at 0, 30, 60, and 120 min after ingestion of the meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma insulin in standard meal tolerance test
secondary_outcome.description: plasma insulin was measured at 0, 30, 60, and 120 min after ingestion of the meal
fasting blood glucose (FBG), postprandial blood glucose (PBG)
glycosylated hemoglobin A 1c (HbA1c) was measured by high-performance liquid chromatography
fat mass and lean tissue were measured by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with gliclazide, liraglutide or metformin adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
other_outcome.description: adverse events caused by the drugs
